entry.title: Finland Joins NATO, Sweden's Accession Remains Uncertain
entry.summary: Finland is at long last joining NATO, having applied together with Sweden last year in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Finland's accession represents a boon to NATO, a radical change in Finnish foreign and security policy, and another unplanned setback for Russia.

entry.title: Supply Chain Interdependence and Geopolitical Vulnerability

author.name: Bradley Martin; Laura H. Baldwin; Paul DeLuca; Natalia Henriquez Sanchez; Mark Hvizda; Colin D. Smith; N. Peter Whitehead

entry.summary: The authors conducted a tabletop exercise to assess the geopolitical implications of Taiwan's semiconductor dominance and the vulnerabilities of the semiconductor supply chain using two scenarios in which China attempted to unify with Taiwan.

entry.title: Whither the Liberal International Order?
entry.summary: Seeks to understand and anticipate the impact of an attenuated or weakened Liberal International Order on propensity, incidence, and intensity of conflict.

entry.title: India-China Border Tensions and U.S. Strategy in the Indo-Pacific
entry.summary: India-China border intrusions and clashes have become more frequent and threaten to lead to all-out conflict between the two Asian giants.

entry.title: Scottish Affairs Committee
entry.summary: The aim of this evidence is to analyse the UK's national security priorities in the North Atlantic and the High North and how to develop Scotland's role as an asset in the pursuit of these priorities.

entry.title: Study Strengthening the Fight Against Organised Crime

author.name: Emma Louise Blondes; Emma Disley; Shann Hulme; Fook Nederveen; Jirka Taylor; Ilia Gaglio; Antonino Sorrenti; Francesco Calderoni

entry.summary: This study looks at three 'tools' that Member States can deploy in the fight against serious and organised crime. The report describes the current state of play and outlines possible policy solutions to address challenges identified.

entry.title: Reflecting on One Year of War
entry.summary: One year after Russia's illegal full-scale invasion of Ukraine, this article examines the role of non-military levers (e.g., diplomatic, information, economic) in the conflict so far.

entry.title: Norway's Next Long-Term Defence Plan
entry.summary: As Norway contemplates the priorities for its next Long-Term Defence Plan (LTP), it finds itself in a Europe, a NATO, and a global environment that have all changed markedly since the last iteration of the Plan was released in 2020.

entry.title: RAND Experts Available to Comment on 20th Anniversary of Iraq War
entry.summary: RAND Corporation experts are available to comment on the 20th anniversary of the Iraq War, being marked on March 20, 2023. They can discuss the historical implications of the war and the decisionmaking that led up to it; the war's lasting impact on returning veterans and on current U.S. foreign and defense policies; and the relevance of Iraq to today's geopolitical climate, including Russia's war with Ukraine, competition with China, and the balance of power in the Middle East.

entry.title: The View of the Taiwan Strait from the U.S.-Japan Alliance

author.name: Matthew Pottinger; Cortez A. Cooper III; Matsuda Yasuhiro; Sheila Smith; Jeffrey W. Hornung

entry.summary: An October 2022 event gathered experts to examine the view of the Taiwan strait from the U.S.-Japan alliance. Presenters considered the Taiwan strait issue from the perspectives of the United States and Japan.

entry.title: RAND Experts Available to Discuss Next Phase of AUKUS Partnership and Nuclear Submarine Deal
entry.summary: RAND Corporation experts are available to comment on the announcement of the first phase of the AUKUS partnership between the United States, Australia, and United Kingdom.

entry.title: What Taiwan's Dominance in Semiconductor Production Means for the U.S.

author.name: Bradley Martin; Laura H. Baldwin; Paul DeLuca; Natalia Henriquez Sanchez; Mark Hvizda; Colin D. Smith; N. Peter Whitehead

entry.summary: Semiconductors have become an integral part of nearly every industry. Production of the highest-end semiconductors exists almost entirely in Taiwan. If China were to unify with Taiwan, there are no good short-term options for responding to the disruption that would cause to the global semiconductor supply chain.

entry.title: Proxy Warfare in Strategic Competition

author.name: Stephen Watts; Bryan Frederick; Nathan Chandler; Mark Toukan; Christian Curriden; Erik E. Mueller; Edward Geist; Ariane M. Tabatabai; Sara Plana; Brandon Corbin; Jeffrey Martini

entry.summary: This report synthesizes the findings and recommendations from two companion reports on intrastate proxy wars: civil wars in which at least one local warring party receives material support from an external state.

entry.title: Proxy Warfare in Strategic Competition

author.name: Stephen Watts; Bryan Frederick; Nathan Chandler; Mark Toukan; Christian Curriden; Erik E. Mueller; Edward Geist; Ariane M. Tabatabai; Sara Plana; Brandon Corbin; Jeffrey Martini

entry.summary: The authors used quantitative analysis and case studies of China, Iran, and Russia to examine the causes and likely future trends in proxy wars: civil wars in which at least one local warring party receives material support from an external state.

entry.title: Proxy Warfare in Strategic Competition

author.name: Stephen Watts; Bryan Frederick; Nathan Chandler; Mark Toukan; Christian Curriden; Erik E. Mueller; Edward Geist; Ariane M. Tabatabai; Sara Plana; Brandon Corbin; Jeffrey Martini

entry.summary: The authors examine the military implications of intrastate proxy wars (civil wars in which at least one local warring party receives material support from an external state) via a literature review and four case studies.

entry.title: Strategic advantage in a competitive age

author.name: James Black; Diana Dascalu; Megan Hughes; Benedict Wilkinson; Maeve Ryan; Ahron Bregman; Peter Carlyon; Jennifer Cheung; Lawrence Freedman; Rebecca Lucas; Alessio Patalano; Patrick Porter; Fiona Quimbre; Sam Stockwell; Mann Virdee

entry.summary: SONAC commissioned RAND Europe to refine their working definition of strategic advantage. The team developed case studies and conducted expert workshops to explore the types of advantage and how actors seek to maintain and exploit their advantages.

entry.title: Quantifying the link between COVID-19, conflict risk, and the global economy

author.name: Grant Johnson; Sean M. Zeigler; Marco Hafner; Catherine Galley

entry.summary: Our research suggests that COVID-19 will significantly increase the risk of civil conflict in African countries. We estimate this effect will, in turn, have negative global repercussions via international trade losses.

entry.title: A Quantitative Analysis of the Costs of Corruption in the EU

author.name: Marco Hafner; Eliane Dufresne; Stijn Hoorens; Emma Disley

entry.summary: The aim of this report is to quantify the economic and societal losses due to corruption in the European Union, and to identify potential for action at EU level, to address the challenges identified.

entry.title: Dara Massicot to Testify Before Senate Armed Services Committee on Russian Military Performance and 2023 Outlook
entry.summary: RAND senior policy researcher Dara Massicot will testify on Tuesday, February 28 before members of the United States Senate Armed Services Committee. She will describe the first year of the Russia-Ukraine conflict, the current Russian offensive, and various contingencies during the year ahead.

entry.title: China's Overseas Military Diplomacy and Implications for U.S. Interests
entry.summary: The expansion of China's global interests and the subsequent increase in its overseas security footprint have led the Chinese leadership to elevate the role of military diplomacy in supporting China's foreign policy objectives.
